main_definition: The term 'discharge' refers to the act of releasing, expelling or allowing something to flow out from a particular source.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To release someone from legal obligations or responsibilities
meanings_and_examples.example: The court decided to discharge him on bail until the trial date.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The action of allowing liquid, gas, or other substances to flow out from a container or reservoir
meanings_and_examples.example: After filling the vase with water, she carefully poured it back into the sink without spilling any.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To release someone from work duties, typically due to illness or other personal reasons
meanings_and_examples.example: He was discharged for a week because he had come down with the flu.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The action of releasing military personnel from active duty after their service period ends
meanings_and_examples.example: After completing his tour, the soldier was officially discharged and welcomed back home by his family.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To send something out for payment or processing
meanings_and_examples.example: The bank will discharge your checks overnight to ensure timely transactions.
